creator: david_haimson@hp.com
text:
Overview Description:
        "tomcat.sh stop" on UNIX only stops tomcat after 3 or 4 tries.
        I built the tomcat source with extra debug output and discovered
        the following:

        The command "org.apache.tomcat.startup.Tomcat -stop" does what
        it is supposed to, that is, send the signal 15 to the ajp12
        connector.

        The ajp12 connector receives the signal every time, and it calls
        contextM.stop() on line 400 of Ajp12ConnectionHandler.java.

        The method ContextManager.stop() on line 533 of
        ContextManager.java is actually NOT executed every time. I
        can't imagine why it wouldn't be, but that is what I observed.
        It seems to be run usually the third or fourth time I try it.

        I include the relevant tomcat configuration below.

    Steps to Reproduce:
        1.  $TOMCAT_HOME/bin/tomcat.sh start
        2.  $TOMCAT_HOME/bin/tomcat.sh stop

    Actual Results:
        When you run the stop command, you see the output:
            Stop tomcat
        but tomcat continues to run. If you repeat the stop command
        three or four times, it usually does finally stop.

    Expected Results:
        I expected it to stop the first time.

    Build Date & Platform
        We downloaded the following binary distribution:
            http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/tomcat/release/v3.2.1/bin/
            jakarta-tomcat-3.2.1.tar.gz   12-Dec-2000 14:29   2.7M
            GZIP compressed file

    Additional Builds and Platforms:

        Occurs on:
            Version 3.2.1 on HPUX
            Version 3.2.1 on Solaris 2.7

        Doesn't occur on:
            Version 3.1 (any platform)
            Version 3.2.1 on Windows NT
            Version 3.2.1 on Windows 2000

    Additional Information:

        We added a context to server.xml:

            <Context debug="0" docBase="/opt/OV/SIP/webapps/ovportal"
                path="/ovportal" reloadable="true"/>

Just wanted to say that I have the sam problem here. HP-UX 11 with HP JDK 1.2,
vanilla Tomcat 3.2.1 without modifications.

According to David Haimson, the original author:

FYI, I just learned that this is an HP-UX Java bug. The HP-UX Java
folks are aware of it and they are working on the problem. I have no
further information about when or in what version it will be fixed.
